userreviews.userReview: Entertaining Like most of her books, it was an entertaining mystery romance. I like that she is a Christian author so I can count on her books being clean and not graphic. Her mystery are interesting but not on the edge of your seat intense. Overall, it was just fun mind candy.
Bland characters. Stilted dialogueI admire authors who aren't afraid to introduce a relationship with God in her characters but not even that could save this. It was just plain dull
Great mystery mixed with sunken ships, unexpected romance and twists and turns.
Good mystery. Well written as always and a great mix of romance and mystery that I enjoy time after time.

I was searching the Kindle Owner's Lending Library for a book to borrow for the month of June. I happened upon this one. Having always enjoyed books by this author, I downloaded it without thinking. Apparently this is book three in a series, although I think it was fine for a standalone book. I enjoyed it, as I expected to. However, I do like to read them in order, so I hope to go back over next few months and borrow #1 (Windigo Twilight) and #2 (Shadow Bones), which are apparently about the other two siblings that were mentioned some in StormCatcher. Also, I think these are older Love Inspired books that were recently re-released. Still, I did enjoy it! :)

I just love these books. Can't wait for the next one. I love the story. Can't wait to read the next one you are my favorite author.I love mystery and love stories.. I have recommend ed the books to my sister. She loves to read too.
Riveting read.Excellent story. Did not expect the ending. Great story line. I couldn't put it down till I finished it. Awesome

Good conclusion to series...loved the Lake Superior and Upper Peninsula setting, plus insights into archeology and especially marine archeology with an appreciation for discovery and preservation. I enjoyed the characters.

Beautiful!!!This was a beautiful love story with some intrique thrown in. It was a good story all around. Greed is never a good motive for anything, and this story proved it. God will always bring you out on top if you seek Him and be truthful.
Fun and easy read.Ending was predictable but that was part of the fun! Easy and quick read fiction especially for a book on the beach.
Nice storyEnjoyed reading it the characters were likeable but a little too perfect. The mystery was engaging and had twists. Very clean
Great readFirst book i have read from this author. Loved this book. Kept me interested till the last word. Cant wait to read more from this author.

description: Uncovering a modern-day crime scene was not how marine archaeologist Wynne Baxter expected to use her diving skills. Yet when handsome family friend Simon Lassiter fell under suspicion in the death of his cousin and former fiancée, Wynne vowed to help him learn the truth, even though it meant risking everything in Superior's stormy waters. But a tempest of a different kind was about to fall on the Lassiter family, and Wynne found herself caught up in the maelstrom. Whom could she trust as the clouds of suspicion and danger rolled in over her head?
title: Stormcatcher
